entry.title: Re: SAP Datasphere Error during package import
entry.content:
Hi,

First try if the view does not contain data (persistency). With changes DSP will not remove the data automatically as it does not know whether you may not need the 'old' version of the data. 

Also, it is possible that the view is 'released'? 

Else use: DW Administrator role and retry 

Please post results here 

Cheers,

Martin

entry.title: Embedded Finance in SAP: SAP Multi-Bank Connectivity with J.P. Morgan Payments
entry.content:
Enterprises are rethinking how to connect banking capabilities with ERP processes to maximize business value. Key questions include:

  • How to make payments, reconciliation, and cash visibility seamless and fully integrated between banks and the ERP system?
  • How to adopt innovations like real-time payments or real-time cash balances without launching a new IT project every time a banking service gets added?
  • How to unlock the combined value of invoice and payment data in the ERP alongside the cash and financial data held by banks?

SAP and J.P. Morgan asked themselves the same questions. And as a result decided to collaborate and partner even closer to bring more value to shared clients by better integrating the capabilities of both by accelerating adoption of SAP Multi-Bank Connectivity (MBC) to deliver J.P. Morgan bank services embedded in ERP processes.

With SAP MBC, corporates get direct, standardized access to J.P. Morgan banking services directly integrated into their payment and cash processes. As a result corporates can scale new services faster, without custom builds and with minimal ongoing maintenance and benefit from the seamless and many times real time data flow to get the decision advantage crucial in todays fast and ever changing business world.

What you can expect

  • Seamless connectivity: Integrate J.P. Morgan services via SAP Multi-Bank Connectivity to connect your SAP ERP to J.P. Morgan Payments using standardized, bank-approved channels.
  • Automate payments and reporting: The J.P. Morgan Payments Adapter 2.0 supports file-based payments (ACH, checks, virtual cards, wiresâ€”including FX) and real-time payments across the U.S., EU, UK, Australia, Singapore, Malaysia, and Hong Kong.
  • Real-time insights: Access instant reporting and reconciliation, view account balances and transaction details, and track payments through advanced APIs.
  • Easy implementation: Prebuilt adapters and help you go live quickly and securely
  • AI-powered treasury: Leverage SAPâ€™s cloud data foundation and AI-driven capabilities to interact with J.P. Morgan and elevate treasury operations.

Who can benefit

  • New and existing J.P. Morgan clients using SAP S/4HANA (Public Cloud, Private Cloud, or On-Premise) or SAP ECC (6.0+)
  • Organizations operating on J.P. Morgan Access, with support for multi-bank reporting across nonâ€“J.P. Morgan DDAs
  • Teams seeking flexible connection options through SAP MBC to tailor integrations to specific business needs

This collaboration meets clients where they are simplifying connectivity while strengthening control and visibility at the same time, and accelerating access to new banking innovations, all embedded in SAP ERP processes.

Want to know more?

  • SAP Multi-Bank Connectivity 
    • https://www.sap.com/germany/products/financial-management/multi-bank-connectivity.html 
    • https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_MULTI_BANK_CONNECTIVITY
  • J.P. Morgan SAP Integration:
    • https://partners.jpmorgan.com/sap_s4hana.html
  • SAP and J.P. Morgan Partnership:
    • https://digital.jpmorgan.com/jpmorgan-with-sap/index.html

Still want to know more?

Meet us at the AFP Conference in Boston on October 26â€“29 or attend SAP and J.P. Morgan session at the AFP and J.P. Morgan Booth on Tuesday Oct 28th  2-2.30pm local Boston time

entry.title: SAP Developer News September 25th, 2025
entry.content:
DESCRIPTION 

Podcast: https://podcast.opensap.info/sap-developers/2025/09/25/sap-developer-news-september-25th-2025/ 

Devtoberfest Begins 

  • https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest/gh-p/Devtoberfest 
  • https://www.youtube.com/@sapdevs 
  • https://www.linkedin.com/showcase/sap-community-official/ 

Devtoberfest Fun Activities 

  • Devtoberfest Fun, Week 1: Scavenger Hunt: https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest-blog-posts/fun-for-week-1-the-devtoberfest-scavenger-hunt/ba-p/14183972 
  • Tutorial for checking hex digits for each mission: https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/devtoberfest2025-scavenger-hunt-checking.html 
  • Tutorial for entering the secret phrase: https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/devtoberfest2025-scavenger-hunt.html 

Favorites and Recent in SAP BTP cockpit 

  • Blog post: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/introducing-favorites-and-recent-in-sap-btp-cockpit-a-personalized/ba-p/14217622 

SAPUI5 version 1.140 

  • Release notes: https://ui5.sap.com/#/topic/26a106cc313d48e6b52b78c7c331f818 

 

CHAPTER TITLES  

0:00 Intro 

0:10 Devtoberfest Begins 

1:16 TechEd Promo from the TechEd Recording in NSQ on Wednesday 

2:25 Devtoberfest Fun Activities 

5:05 Favorites and Recent in SAP BTP cockpit 

 

TRANSCRIPTION

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for September 25th, 2025.

[Kevin] Hey folks, Kevin here. Devtoberfest 2025 is almost here. Launching next week on Monday, September 29th. Get ready for over 80 expert-led sessions. Packed with knowledge, innovation, and real-world developer insights. And it's not just tech talk. We've got loads of fun. joined our legendary scavenger hunt, adorable pet-toberfest, mind-bending puzzles, and exciting coders' challenges. Earn participation points as you go and get a shot at the grand prize just by joining in and having fun. All sessions will stream live on YouTube via the SAP Developers channel. By the way, thank you for 50,000 subscribers. And you can also find them linked on our SAP Community LinkedIn events. So on one end, find all the details and join the fun in the SAP community. As always, the link is in the description below. We can't wait to see you there. Get ready, get coding, and join the Devtoberfest fun.

[Tom & Rich] Hey, we're here in the Newtown Square area this week, doing some pre-recording for SAP TechEd. How's the experience been for you so far, Rich? I'm not an actor, so it's kind of weird. uh it's been kind of fun though we uh we did some uh social media clips uh playing some uh what would you call them uh almost like uh icebreaker games and a thing and uh we have some funny pictures to go along throughout the day we've been wearing a camera strapped to our body and we're just going to make for some interesting footage while eating a lollipop yeah yeah and coding um i got to wear it on a treadmill so it's been a it's been a wild day We've got some fun stuff coming for you for TechEd. We've got some surprises that we won't reveal, even though we've had them here. But, yeah, so if you haven't signed up for TechEd virtual, that was a great time. No reason to wait for the very end. And if you're planning to join us in Berlin, we look forward to seeing you there. Yep. So any advice for everybody as you get ready for TechEd? Get ready. It's going to be a great show. Yep, I agree. See you all there. Bye-bye.

[Daniel] Devtoberfest has over 80 technical sessions From ABAP to integration to, of course, AI But you know, you can't learn all day You have to have a little fun So we put together a bunch of games, puzzles, and challenges So you can have a little fun And earn thousands and thousands of points Towards the grand prize Week one, we officially release The Scavenger Hunt where you will search through all types of SAP developer resources to find a secret phrase. More on that in a minute. In week two, we release the ever-popular Pettoberfest where you can upload pictures of your pets or any animal that you like. There'll be a little bit of an AI twist to that. Week three, we will release the SAP CryptoCrossword, which has become a tradition, And I'm particularly proud of how it came out this year. We will also have three other puzzles, one on event-based process code jam that we run, another on programming languages, and another one on the developer advocates themselves. And on week four, we will have coders challenges, one for ABAP, one for CAP, and one for SAP Build. Okay, now to the scavenger hunt. Check out my blog for all of the details, including instructions on the 10 missions through all types of SAP developer resources, like the Discovery Center or Help Portal, or even the Developer News. And you will search for one to six hexadecimal digits each time, and by the end of Devtoberfest, you can put them together to find the secret phrase. So now I'm releasing the very first two hexadecimal digits for you to use in the scavenger hunt. In chess, there's a thing called the king's gambit, which is an aggressive opening to sacrifice a pawn to improve the position for white. For that to work, black has to move a specific pawn. his king's pawn, and that pawn is the clue to the hexadecimal digits for today. Any ideas? Subscribe to my blog to be notified of every time we release a new clue for the scavenger hunt. And if you have any questions or difficulties, leave a comment in the blog. Good luck.

[Ajay] Hello, developers. Greetings of the day. I'm very happy to share with you a new enhancement for SAP BTP Cockpit, Favorites and Recents. This feature provides immediate access to important resources from everywhere in the cockpit. This will help you to focus and be more productive while you are working with a multitude of accounts, applications, and services. With a growing number of sub-accounts and service instances and spaces, Favorite and Recent feature greatly simplify the navigation. You can bookmark your most important resources with the favorites, while Recent will show you the resources that you recently worked with. You can even filter on your bookmarks. You also have the possibility to provide your feedback for this new feature and make the experience even better. To learn more about favorites and recents, please read the detailed blog post by Anika. You'll find the link to this blog post in the description.

[Nico] Hi everyone and welcome to the SAP Developer News. Just a quick update on the SAP UI5 version 1.140 that was just released. A few minor deprecation infos, so as always, there's some older UI5 versions that will now be deprecated for the CDNs, so make sure to update. And also deprecated is the analysis path framework, so if you're using the APF, make sure to switch. It's still officially supported, but it's devised to no longer use it. a few other interesting updates so there's now a typed json model so in case you use typescript and the json model definitely check that one out there's a few updates to the odata v4 model as well some other controls receive little updates make sure to check the release notes and something else i saw was that the color of the title and the tool header changed so check it out and test to see what that now looks like and let me know what you think about that in the comments. All right, hope to see you soon. Bye.

entry.content:
Hi SAP,

Is there a way to enable a direct association of the Field in Custom Business Object to a Custom CDS view (ValueHelp) that contains the Business roles?

 

Kind regards. 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Direct association in Custom Business Object to a Cus...
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

 

You can use the Custom CDS View app to create customized value helps for custom business object fields of type Association to Business Object. This value help view needs to have the associated business object as primary data source. 

Check the documentation Adding a Value Help with the Custom CDS Views App for more information. 

 

Kind regards.

entry.title: Success Connect 2025: Gain practical insights for moving from SAP ERP HCM to the cloud
entry.content:
Excitement is in the air as Success Connect is almost upon us. This is my 13th year attending Success Connect and I can honestly say that I look forward to this event every year. Helping our SAP ERP HCM customers migrate their legacy HR systems to the cloud is an important part of my job and something that I am very passionate about. Thatâ€™s why Iâ€™m excited to share with you that this year we will have dedicated track with content specifically designed for our on-premises customers who are looking to move HR to the  cloud.

Thereâ€™s never been a better moment to rethink how your HR systems support your business. Moving from SAP ERP HCM to the cloud isnâ€™t just a technology upgrade, itâ€™s an opportunity to unlock agility, insights, and smarter ways of working. At Success Connect at SAP Connect 2025, the Move to the cloud with practical insights for SAP ERP HCM customers track is packed with sessions designed to give you the clarity, guidance, and hands-on knowledge needed for a  successful cloud journey.

Why attend this track?

Whether youâ€™re just beginning to explore your options or actively planning your migration, youâ€™ll gain actionable takeaways to ensure a successful cloud transformation, including tools and strategies you can use to plan, execute, and optimize your journey.

This track helps you:

  • Make informed decisions on migration strategies and priorities.
  • Learn from real-world examples to help you reduce risk and drive adoption.
  • Gain best practice guidance from SAP experts.
  • Connect with other organizations navigating similar cloud migration journeys.

Hereâ€™s an overview of the content you can expect to see:

Roadmap & Vision

Get a clear view of SAPâ€™s cloud vision, strategy and roadmap for SAP SuccessFactors HCM, including core HR, time, and payroll. Learn about specific enhancements that support industry specific applications in the public sector.

Strategy Talks, Deep Dives & Quick Tips

Learn what you need to know about moving from SAP ERP HCM to SAP SuccessFactors HCM directly from SAP experts. Discover the new Evo Guide, a comprehensive, step-by-step resource for executives, project managers, and decision-makers designed to give you everything you need to know to accelerate your organizationâ€™s HR transformation. Explore the SAP Readiness Check tool to learn how to gain rapid insights into your current on-premise system landscape and confidently plan your migration to the cloud.

Customer Success Stories

Hear directly from organizations that have successfully transitioned to SAP SuccessFactors HCM, including AMD, Amtrak, Purdue University and Tenneco. Learn strategies for approaching the project, what worked well, any lessons learned, and the measurable impact realized from moving HR to the cloud.

Meet the experts, demo stations and networking opportunities

Be sure to take advantage of the many opportunities available to you beyond the breakout sessions. Schedule time to meet with our solution experts in a dedicated 1:1 meeting, swing by the demo stations to see our solutions in action and get your questions answered, and network with your peers at the celebration night.  

Donâ€™t wait â€” secure your spot at Success Connect at SAP Connect 2025 in Las Vegas or the virtual event!  Explore the agenda builder to plan your schedule, and plan your cloud transformation journey. 

Iâ€™m looking forward to seeing you all in Las Vegas!

entry.title: Introducing the WalkMe-based alternative in-app help user experience: What and How to Activate
entry.content:
Good news! With the 2508 upgrade, SAP has released 12 standard, non-customizable WalkMe flows, ideal for accountants and sales representatives (no extra license; activation needed). 

SAP recently acquired WalkMe, which is a digital adoption platform that overlays your application to guide users how to navigate workflows step-by-step. Think of it as a tutorial with little bubbles that pop up and tell users where to click and what to input in fields when they're trying to complete a process, like create a sales order. 

Turn this on once and your users get stepâ€‘byâ€‘step help in 33 languages* for highâ€‘impact sales and finance tasks: Sales (Find/Edit/Create Order, Set Delivery Block, Add Shipping Instructions), Finance (Find/Change/Reverse/Copy Journal Entry, Customize Line Item View, View Related Documents), plus a homepage tour. These Smart Walk-Thrus are especially helpful to new users who need in-app guidance. Subject to change.

Persona

Embedded Flows

Apps in Scope

 General Accountant

  • Find a Journal Entry
  • Customize Line Item View
  • Change Line Item in a Journal Entry
  • Reverse Journal Entry
  • Copy a Journal Entry
  • View related documents in a Journal Entry

Manage Journal Entries - New Version (F0717A)

 Sales Rep

  • Create a Sales Order
  • Find a Sales Order
  • Edit a Sales Order
  • Set a Delivery Block
  • Add Shipping Instructions

Manage Sales Order - Version 2 (F3893)

 All Personas

  • Welcome to My Home

MyHome

 
*For more information like the available languages, please see SAP Note 3609634.

Note: If you are using SAP Enable Now, the WalkMe-based alternative in-app help user experience or WalkMe Premium is not available.

Activate (2â€“3 minutes): 

  1. Replace "Shell-home" with "#Shell-startGUI?sap-ui2-tcode=FTG_EXTERNAL" in the URL address to reach the configuration page within your customizing tenant (development/quality). This is a quick shortcut to reach the configuration activity page.
    1. Alternatively, navigate step-by-step to the configuration activity page:
      1. 2SL Customers with SB: Navigate to app "Manage Your Solution" -> Configure Your Solution -> Filter for "Application Area" - Application Platform and Infrastructure"; "Sub Application Area" - "General Settings" -> Basic Settings -> Configuration Steps -> Activate Features -> Configure
      2. 2SL & 3SL Customers with CBC: Navigate to app "Implementation Activities" -> General Settings-> Cross Application -> Activate New Features->Activate Features -> IMG Activity (clock with check symbol)

  2. Select feature: APS_UI_WME_INTEGRATION. Click 'Activate/Deactivate Feature' button near the top.
  3. Create/select transport if prompted. Name Transport to your liking. Close.
  4. Confirm State turns from red to green. Try the flows in dev before exporting to test and prod.

What happens next:

  • Open apps like Manage Journal Entries - New Version or Manage Sales Orders - Version 2 and click the question mark icon at the top of your page to open the WalkMe menu. Click on the Smart Walk Thrus under the Tours tab and youâ€™ll see the bubbles guiding each step.
  • Notify the relevant users (ie. accountants and sales reps) how to find this and use this.

If you're interested in more WalkMe capabilities, like custom flows, analytics, and cross-app functionality (SAP and non-SAP apps), contact your SAP Customer Success Manager to find out more.

Have questions? Letâ€™s chat in the comments!

entry.title: Seeking Practical Approach for Import Shipping & Customs Management in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
Dear SAP users,

I hope this message finds you well.

I'm currently supporting a customer who is using SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, and we are facing some challenges around import shipping, customs clearance, and inventory-in-transit tracking.

At the moment, the customer is managing these processes manually using Excel, and we're looking for a way to transition this into SAP to improve control and visibility. However, due to the lack of Global Trade Management (GTM/GTS) capabilities in the Public Cloud, we understand that full automation may not be feasible.

We are exploring alternative approaches and would appreciate any insights on the following:

Best practices for managing import processes (shipping documents, customs clearance info, and in-transit inventory) within the limitations of SAP Public Cloud.

Any known customer cases or reference implementations where similar functionality has been built or approximated â€” e.g., using custom fields, custom apps, or external system integrations.

For intercompany scenarios:

The customerâ€™s headquarters is running S/4HANA (likely Private Cloud or On-Premise).

They are open to exchanging shipping and customs data via interface (I/F) between the group companies.

We would appreciate your recommendations on how to best handle such data exchange and visibility in the Public Cloud system.

We are aiming for a practical and maintainable solution, even if it involves partial automation or semi-manual processes through custom objects.

Any guidance, documentation, or real-world examples you could provide would be extremely helpful.

Looking forward to your thoughts.

 

Best regards,

Yuna / SAP Consultant

Hello @Ivn_Escudero66 

Only extend what the FDP shows and manage grouping within the template. If you require data not available through the FDP, consider raising an influence/incident or creating a custom app and form for your needs.

You can refer to the useful SAP documentation below.

SAP Help: Creating Data Source Extensions and Output Extensibility features you can add to forms. SAP Help Portal

Developer extensibility context, including custom services and forms for tailored applications. SAP Community

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: #CoE#OTMC Zscaler and SAP Router
entry.content:
Hi there

We use SAP Router to manage our connection between SuccessFactors in the Public Cloud and SAPGUI, which our technical support team use.  SAP Router is in an EC2 instance in our AWS tenancy. 

We are now looking at moving SAP Router to an Azure Virtual Machine which is protected by Zscaler.  I've looked online and there is nothing about how SAP Router and Zscaler can work together.  What there is online refers to Zscaler Private Network supplanting SAP Router but there is a lack of clarity around how that would work with SAPGUI given that SAP have private protocols authenticating SAP Router and SAP GUI.

Regardless I would be very grateful if anyone could provide some advice on their experience migrating SAP Router into an environment protected by Zscaler Zero-Trust policies, and whether it's even possible.  I do appreciate that this is quite an edge case, but I'm hoping that someone has run into this before and can help me out.

entry.title: Error in an SAP Integration Suite integration
entry.content:
Hello, good afternoon.
We encountered an error when trying to run an integration included in the Mexico Document Compliance Generic package. The problem is that when we add an example XML with fictitious values, we don"t have a PAC configured yet and want to simulate a response and test these integrations.
The error is in the mapping between the input XML and the configured XSD.
The error is the following: com.sap.aii.mappingtool.tf7.IllegalInstanceException: Cannot produce target element /ns3:PACResponse. Queue has not enough values â€‹â€‹in context. Target XSD requires a value for this element, but target field mapping does not produce one. Probably the XML-instance is not valid for the source XSD, or the target field mapping does not meet the requirement of the target XSD. on the exchange: Exchange[03B9D4CF234F9BE-0000000000000003]

Thank you very much for the support

Regards, Christopher Rivas

entry.title: Re: Free Good Processing (BKA) Scope Item is not working...
entry.content:
Hello @yv4dng2 

This is expected behaviour in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition: for scope item BKA â€“ Free Goods Processing, the system does not generate a separate free-goods line. Instead, it applies a 100% discount (condition D100) to the qualifying item. SAP confirms that BKA does not involve â€œadditional item generation.â€ SAP Support Portal-2822952 - Free Goods Processing does not generate a separate free goods item

Quick checks

Ensure that Free Goods Determination is enabled in your configuration and that your condition record is valid for the specific sales area, material, UoM, and validity dates. SAP Help-free trade 

Maintain/verify records in Manage Free Goods

If you need a separate free line

Use BDA for free delivery with a dedicated order type; this ensures that the line item becomes free via D100 in the pricing procedure. This process generates deliverable items at no cost, with the option of a pro forma or zero invoice.SAP Learning-Understanding Free of Charge Delivery Process

Let me know if it works

With regards

Chuma

Based on your screenshot, the unresponsive page is usually due to either browser compatibility or a stuck tenant session.

entry.title: Re: Issues with SAP Practical test module of SAP S/4HANA...
entry.content:
Hello @OlanrewajuBello 

This appears to be the SAP Learning Practice System. When the page remains frozen on task 1, itâ€™s usually a browser, session, pop-up, or cookie issue.

Begin by restarting the practice system via the Practice Systems tile using Resume/Reset, then launch it again from that point.

Use Chrome/Edge Incognito mode and enable pop-ups and third-party cookies for the learning/S4 domains. Some CBC/SSCUIs open in a new pop-up and may be blocked. SAP Support Portal-3251919 - UI5 web browser error appears during configuration in CBC

Perform a hard refresh / clear cache and try again classic Fiori Launchpad troubleshooting SAP Help Portal-SAP Fiori App Cannot Be Opened

If it continues to freeze, submit a ticket to SAP Learning Support via the Learning Help Center â†’ Practice systems support, and include your screenshot, time, and system ID.

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Synchronous Goods Receipt
entry.content:
Hello @VickiG1 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Manufacturing Order Type, Integration Scenario with EWM & EWM Synchronous Goods Movement

Yes, you are correct. To enable synchronous Goods Receipt and Goods Issue you only need to update your Order-Type dependent parameters.

Make sure your WM request field is set to No Creation of Transfer Requirements because synchronous posting eliminates the need for separate requests.

You do not need to customise in EWM but make sure your bin mapping and stock type settings are correct. The implications are that inbound deliveries and warehouse tasks are no longer created, postings happen immediately during confirmation and process become faster but are less transparent. Which in place handles errors stricter.

I hope this provides the desired insight.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Not able to find API for " SALES QUOTATION SIMULATE"...
entry.content:
Hello @S0027059815 

Thank you for your question.

I recommend looking at Sales Quotations API, Simulate Creation of Sales Order & Sales Quotation for more details.

To summarise, there is no released API for Sales Quotation Simulate in public cloud. You have the option to use the Sales Quotation OData API but this only enables you to create, read, update or delete and not simulate.

I recommend you use the Sales Order Simulate API because it provides simulated pricing, taxed and conditions without persisting the order. You can also pass the same input data you would use for quotation.

I hope this provides the desired insight.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Dunning per Mail/Printing only if there is no Mail-Ad...
entry.content:
Hello @FabianSCC 

Thank you for your question.

I recommend looking at Output Management & Configuring Dunning and Outputs for details.

In summary, based on the details you provided, the issue seems not to be with the Exclusive Indicator but with the condition in your second row.

You should keep default email address = is not initial, channel = email, exclusive Indicator = X for the email row. You are required to set default email address = is initial, channel = print.

Without the condition in the second row, the system cannot differentiate and will not print in the fallback case.

I hope this provides the desired insight.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: SAPS4PC -BAdI for Updating Custom Field During PO Cre...
entry.content:
Thank you for your question.

I recommend looking at Extensibility, App Extensibility: Manage Purchase Orders & https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0e602d466b99490187fcbb30d1dc897c/044700714fc54863b7fa9ea0b5654ba0.html?locale=en-US

To summarise, the MM_PUR_S4_PO_ITEM_MAP is the suitable enhancement spot and it allows you to map custom fields from your source documents such as contract to the PO item. Alternatively, MM_PUR_S4_PO_ITEM can also be used if you need to enrich values in the PO item directly.

You can achieve this by creating your own custom field and enable it for both contract item and PO item. Thereafter, implement the BAdI in CFL and do the necessary mapping. You can test it by creating a PO with reference to a contract.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Print SES - Service Entry Sheets from Purchase Orders
entry.content:
Thank you for your question.

I recommend looking at Service Entry Sheet, S/4HANA Cloud Output Management - Purchase Order & Custom Form Template for more details.

To summarise, service receipts do not have a standard print form delivered like material receipts in public cloud. The message you received appears because you cannot reuse the material receipt output formats directly for ESOA. To enable printing, you will need to:

  • Make use of the Output parameter determination with the service entry sheet category.
  • You can either use a delivered output type for SES or create your won custom form template and assign it to ESOA.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: RAP Behavior extension of Production Order
entry.content:
Hello @swedish23 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at App Extensibility in Production Operations, Extensibility: Production Order Confirmation & RAP On-Stack Developer Extensibility for more details.

To summarise, although the BO is extensible, public cloud does not support all RAP features in behaviour extension.  You received the error because determination on save is not allowed in BO extensions. Public cloud currently supports validations, action and field control.

If you need to influence production order field values, I recommend you use released BadIs. Alternatively, you can also use CFL to enrich values. SAP BTP side-by-side extensibility offers you options for complex defaults, and you can update orders through released APIs.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Request to Update Default Login in Universal ID
entry.content:
Please use the S-user ID instead of the email address to log in. If logged in with an email address, the default S-user will be the one used to log in to SAP ID Service.

For several S-users linked with the same email address, to change the default login S-user: 
1. Access SAP ID Service.
2. Click 'Log Out'.
3. Log in again using the desired S-user ID. 
4. After successfully changing, the updated S-user will appear first.

Detail information please refer to KBA 3650023 - Unable to Select Linked Accounts After Logging into SAP for Me with Universal ID - SAP Universal ID (UID)

entry.title: Re: SAP Analytic Cloud has really limited functionalities...
entry.content:
Hi,

you have raised some very practical points. Many of us who have used Power BI or Tableau notice the same differences when we start working in SAC. Let me share my view in short.

 

ðŸ”¹ Linked Dimension Limitation

You are right, in SAC the linked dimension must appear in the widget, otherwise the relationship does not work.
This is because SAC treats it as front-end blending, not as a semantic model join like Power BI.

 

ðŸ”¹ Calculations

SAC is stricter between measures and dimensions.
For complex logic (sum, avg, count, conditions like Sales > 100), you need Restricted/Calculated measures in the model.

 

ðŸ”¹ Data Models in Stories vs Data Analyzer

Stories are limited to prepared models, so flexibility feels less compared to Power Pivot.
The Data Analyzer allows more OLAP-style exploration, but it is separate from the Story environment.

 

ðŸ”¹ Where SAC is Stronger

  • SAC ensures consistent governance: calculations and joins are controlled in the model layer, avoiding ad-hoc mismatches.
  • Integration with BW/HANA means business rules and hierarchies are reused directly, unlike Power BI/Tableau where relationships are defined outside the ERP.
  • This approach gives trusted numbers for finance and costing teams, even if flexibility is less for ad-hoc slicing.

 


So yes, SAC feels more rigid compared to Power BI or Tableau, but the trade-off is stronger control, governance, and trusted data when you are working with enterprise systems like BW and S4. It depends on whether you value flexibility or consistency more for your use case.

entry.title: Re: SAC Waterfall Custom Hierarchy Dimension
entry.content:
Hello, thanks for raising this point.

Hierarchy Activation in Model
When you create a custom hierarchy in SAC (like YearMonth), you must first ensure it is enabled in the model. Open the model, go to the Calendar Month dimension, and check if your custom hierarchy is listed and marked as active.

Hierarchy Usage in Story
In the story, after selecting Calendar Month, use the â€œâ€¦â€ (more options) menu on the chart axis to switch from Flat Presentation to your YearMonth hierarchy. If not switched, the output will look flat even if hierarchy exists.

Validation Step
Also confirm that your hierarchy has at least two levels (for example, Year â†’ Month). If it is a single-level group, SAC will not visually change the chart output.

Hope this helps clarify where to enable and apply the hierarchy. This small step often resolves such display issues quickly.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to get access to the Availability app in SAP for...
entry.content:
Dear customer,

To check the content in the Availability application, your S-user ID must have one of the following authorizations:

  • Display System Data
  • Edit System Data

Kindly refer to KBA 2587408 - S-user ID authorizations for Cloud Availability and Manage Cloud Service Availability Notifications (Get Notified) - SAP for Me.

Please request for the authorizations using the Self-Service authorization request feature per KBA 2891528. 

You may also contact your Super User or user admin directly to get the missing authorizations.

Hope the above information helps.

Thanks and regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: Unleashing Creativity with Cloud-Based AI Apps: 2025 Premium Hub CoE High School Summer Orientation
entry.content:
This summer, a group of bright high school students embarked on an exciting journey at SAP's week-long STEM orientation program. This program focused on harnessing the power of cloud-based AI apps using the SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), providing students with practical, hands-on learning experiences using low-code/no-code tools.

 

 

Building the Foundation with SAP Build Apps:

The week kicked off with students getting an introduction into SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) and Artificial Intelligence at SAP. A key component of the learning experience was SAP Build Apps, a powerful tool within SAP BTP that enabled students to design and develop applications using a low-code/no-code approach. This tool simplified the app creation process, allowing students to focus on functionality and creativity rather than complex coding.

The primary task was to create a barcode scanner application using SAP Build Apps. This app scanned barcodes and retrieved detailed information about food items from the Open Food Facts API, a free and open database of food product information. This integration taught students how to connect their applications to external data sources, demonstrating the potential of combining SAP BTP with other digital resources.

Adding a Generative AI Twist:

The real magic happened when students were introduced to Google Gemini, allowing them to enhance their applications with Generative AI capabilities. By integrating AI into their apps, students were able to analyze the health aspects of food ingredients, transforming simple barcode scanners into intelligent, interactive applications. This exercise encouraged students to think critically about how AI can enhance user experiences and provide valuable insights.

Showcasing Innovation:

As the week progressed, students eagerly worked on their projects, each bringing their own flair to the task. They showcased the culmination of their hard work in a demo session held on Friday, presenting their enhanced applications. It was inspiring to see how each participant leveraged the tools and guidance provided to create something truly remarkable.

Reflecting on the Experience:

The orientation week was not just about building apps; it was about fostering a spirit of innovation and collaboration. The students left with more than just technical skills; they gained confidence and a deeper understanding of how technology can be used to solve real-world problems.

The feedback from participants has been overwhelmingly positive, with many expressing how the program has sparked a new interest in technology and AI.

Here's what one of our students had to say about their unforgettable experience:

â€œThank you so much for organizing such a great practicum experience at SAP. I really enjoyed the week and learned a lot, especiallyâ€during the project work and all the tours. Getting to explore the SAP Build platform and contribute to the barcode scanner project was a really cool experience, and it helped me understand how tech is used in the real world.

I also really appreciated how friendly and supportive everyone was throughout the week. The tours of the MCC and Smart Factory, as well as the leadership talk on the last day, were really inspiring and gave me a better idea of the kinds of roles I might want to explore in the future.

Thanks again for the opportunity, and Iâ€™m really grateful for the experience!â€- Mehul Vijayvergiya

 

Looking Forward:

This orientation was a testament to the power of education and technology in shaping the minds of tomorrow's innovators. As we continue to provide these opportunities, we are excited to see how these young minds will contribute to the ever-evolving tech landscape.

 

Thank you toâ€¯Balaji Rao Gaddamâ€¯for sponsoring and hosting this yearâ€™s event.  

Thank you to the SAP colleagues who coordinated this yearâ€™s Summer Orientation and made it a success!

 

Ashok Kumar M & Megan Rech (Leads) Nkem Ohanenye (Project Co-Coordinator), Savannah Cole (HR) and volunteers and speakers. A huge thank you to our onsite team coordinators Nkem Ohanenye, Sean David, Prasad Gagarani, and Manas Trivedi.


And a special thanks to the SAP speakers and colleagues who shared their expertise!
John Astill (D-Shop Demo), Evan Taylor (STAR Internship Program), Justin Lynch (SAP Overview & Career Development), George Harwood (NSQ Campus Tour), Haibo Huang & Vivek RR (Artificial Intelligence Experts), SooWan Bag and Peter Yeung (Industry 4.0 Center Tour), Manuel Gruber, Julia Cuellar, Rob, Bulusu, Hubertus Oswald (MCC Presentation).

 

#STEM #PremiumHubCoE

entry.title: Re: Indonesia Billing & IV with Down Payment, down paymen...
entry.content:
Check this SAP Help document Down Payment and Down Payment Request 

Key points from this page:

  • You can define down payment categories (mandatory, voluntary, not active) at PO header or item level.
  • When you post an incoming invoice in MIRO, the system proposes all down payments that were posted with reference to the PO and not yet cleared.
  • The system then posts a down payment clearing document together with the invoice document.
  • This ensures that the final invoice amount is reduced by the down payment amount.

entry.title: Re: "Enabling Additional Functionalities for Internal Hir...
entry.content:
Hi @prasad1315,

When you enable the switch "Enabling Additional Functionalities for Internal Hires in Onboarding ", only the internal Hire context is used for triggering email. Other context if its set to Yes or No, will not be considered. So even when you keep the context as Yes for onboarding the business rule will still work. 

 

Thank you,

Regards,

Tabassum

entry.title: Re: Remove Partnership Basics from specific users SAP for Me
entry.content:
Regarding to your request, please refer to KBA 1271517 - Important Contact descriptions and how to view/change S-users with important functions - SAP for Me

Abstract below information for your reference:

To add/remove partner roles and authorizations for S-user IDs, the company's Partner Security Manager (S-user) must make the changes in the SAP Partner Portal according to KBA 2609123. 

If customer is a partner account and needs help maintaining their company's S-user partner authorizations or their administrators -- or there are no Partner User Administrator who can do these tasks -- contact SAP Partner Support using the "Get Support" on the partner "Get assistance" dashboard.

entry.content:
In SAP SuccessFactors User Assistance, weâ€™ve been working on improving your information experience.

Latest People Profile

We have made more enhancements to the latest People Profile, including redesigned Editing UI and History UI. For more information, refer to Latest People Profile.  

Employment Guide Moved

We listened to your feedback and have now merged the Implementing and Managing the Employment Lifecycle (from Hiring to Termination) guide into the Implementing Employee Central Core guide.

However, any saved links will redirect you to the new guide location.

In addition, based on feedback from our partners, we have added a new topic to better explain the connections between events, event reason, and employee status. 

For more information, refer to System Behavior for Events, Event Reasons, and Employee Status.   

Understanding Employee Central Settings

We have added a new topic to the Employee Central Core guide to understand more details about the features you can enable in your system. We have added more information about dependencies between the settings as well as links to the related guides. For more information, refer to Help with Employee Central Settings.

Understanding Employee Central Position Management Permissions

We have added a new topic to the Implementing Position Management guide to help you understand the permissions that admins and managers need. For more information, refer to Permissions for Position Management | SAP Help Portal.

Your Feedback on Position Management Documentation

entry.title: Re: New hire task is visible to manager for onboardee
entry.content:
Hi @gaurav95-g ,

Please check if the NHDR step is configured in the Process variant selected for the candidate. Post this you can check in the BPE monitor process if the NHDR step is triggered or landed into error. 

Also validate the business rule ONB2_ECDataCollectionCheck. This rule should be evaluated to True.
